result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean A. Powless was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit granted.  Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 2.

records.addlTxt: 16CF152, 17CF118, 04PA9PJ & 06FA156 Cases called @ 11:56 a.m. Defendant Dean A. Powless in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Kimberly Stebbins appeared for the Child Support Agency. 16CF152 & 17CF118 -  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel and wishes to procees to plea/sentencing today. Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 17CF118: Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping contrary to Wis Stat 946.49(1)(a).  Plea: 16CF152: Ct 1 - NC. 17CF118: Ct 1 - NC.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   16CF152: Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Cts 3 & 4 - DRI. The defendant waives his right to a PSI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Statement by DE regarding sentencing.  Court orders: 16CF152:  4 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH -  18 mos IC/30 mos ES -  33 days CFTS. ES Conditions: AODA and follow through, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, Not to possess or ingest any impairing substances unless ordered by a physician, 30 mos DL rev/ 30 mos IID, OWI Assessment, $2800 fine inclusive of costs plus $42.50 Blood Draw Cost - defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims. Defendant is not eligible for CIP. Defendant is eligible for SAP. Bond previously posted to be applied. 17CF118: 90 days WC Jail - Concurrent w/ 16CF152, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.  The Court withdraws all of the warrants on 04PA9PJ & 06FA156 and 12CF61 & 14CF121 and those issues will be held until a hearing is scheduled by CSA.
Payment hearing on June 30, 2017 at 11:30 am.

16CF152, 17CF118, 04PA9PJ & 06FA156 Cases called @ 1:11 p.m. Defendant Dean A. Powless in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Ruth Zouski appeared for the Child Support Agency. 17CF118 -   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant refused SPD services and will be proceeding pro se. The Court finds that there has been a waiver of counsel for the purpose of pre-trial discussions. ADA Anderson requesting $6000 Cash Bond as to both 17CF118 & 16CF152. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $7500 Cash Bond - $3000 of which has already been posted. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Atty Zouski requesting that the child support and the failure to pay matters track along with the criminal cases.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Non appearance for Review hearing 04-13-2017

Case Called @ 11:30 AM: Defendant Dean A. Powless in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appears via telephone for P/S.  Per ADA:  Moves to amend Ct 2 to Misd Level Battery.  Pleas to be entered to Ct Nos 2 and 3.  Ct 1 to be DRI.  Def and Counsel concur with State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's motion to amend Ct 2 to Misd Battery contrary to s. 940.19(1)(a) Plea Ct 2:  NC.  Plea Ct 3:  NC.  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Factual basis to accept pleas.  Ct 1 DRI.  Statement prior to sentencing by victim.  Statement by Def:  Yes.   The Court:  Will accept recommendation as appropriate.  Imposes 120 days WCJ for each charge - concurrent to one another - GT and Huber Privileges - 7 days TS credit - Report  1/5/2016 at 8:00 PM - Court Costs - 60 DTP - DNA surcharge - Sample to be provided today if not already done so.  No objection to transfer of SEH if arrangements can be made.  Appeal Rights Given.  No Sample required to be provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-10-2015 10:30 am

Case Called @ 2:08 PM:  Defendant Dean A. Powless in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered as to all 3 counts of INFO.  Def states that there may be a resolution as per their converation after Court on 8/21/2015.  Def has spoken with counsel representing him in Green Lake and does not have counsel yet and still deciding on counsel issue. Confirms discussion with the DA after the last hearing and unsure if offer will be accepted. Victim joins the hearing via telephone.  Pending cases continue in Green Lake and Marquette Co.  STC adjourned until after upcoming hearings in the other counties.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Arraignment at 08-26-2015 01:45 pm

Case Called @ 11:05 AM: Defendant Dean A. Powless in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Did speak with Def prior to going of record and believes Mr. Powless is still in the process of seeking alternate counsel, though would like to proceed today without counsel.  Def confirms that he is still in the process of retaining counsel.  Court again makes a referral to SPD for eligibility, Def is free to contact SPD to determine if they would be willing to appoint alternate counsel.  Def confirms he wants to proceed with the pre-lim today.  Dep Scott Eagan sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  Record to reflect positive ID of Defendant by witness.  Cross Exam by Defendant.  No Argument.  The Court:  Probable cause demonstrated that a felony offense occurred.  Def BOT.  Specifically states a Probable Cause finding for each of the 3 offense currently alleged in the criminal complaint including Felony Offense alleged in Ct 2.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted by Defendant.  INFO Stated by Court.  Def requests to not enter a plea today.  ARGN to be scheduled.  Court notes that counsel has been advised that there is officer unavaibility for JT currently scheduled for 9/17/2015.  Defendant requests in light of current search for counsel that he be allowed to speak with the State on his own before finalizing counsel issue.  State is willing to speak with Defendant today without counsel due to Def's request.  The Court will allow Defendant to meet directly with the DA today as per his wishes.  Any further scheduling required on the Jury Trial will be taken up at the ARGN.  Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
from Patrol Sergeant Re: Conflict with 8/21/2015 and 9/17/2015 Hearings

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 08-21-2015 11:00 am

Case Called @ 2:10 PM: Defendant Dean A. Powless in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes for the record that a Motion for Withdrawal has just been filed by defense counsel.  Def confirms that Atty Zamzow withdraw from the case.  Advises Defendant that Jury Trial will not be adjourned any further.  Court explains available options on Trial date and counsel.  Statement by Def - does not believe that he is the cause of delays on moving case forward.  Statement by Defendant.  Case is set to be tried on the date scheduled.  The Court:  The 9/17/2015 Jury Trial will not be adjourned further.  Def states at no time did he waive his pre-lim hearing.  Per DA:  Time limits for pre-lim were waived.  At no time has there ever been a request for scheduling a pre-lim.   950 interest is present today and pre-lim could be conducted today if necessary.  Def is not prepared to have pre-lim conducted today without counsel.  He is in the process of obtaining counsel from Madison area.  Court believes that matter should be scheduled for pre-lim prior to JT.  Court will permit Atty Zamzow to withdraw.  Def will be responsible for hiring his own counsel.  Counsel to be present for the scheduled pre-lim and Jury Trial.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:35 PM: Defendant Dean A. Powless in court, appearing via video conference, pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Ruth Zouski, Corporation Counsel, also present Court.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he does have counsel and was simply late for last hearing.  It is believed that his current attorney will be withdrawing.  DA argues as to cash bond of $450.00 - bond modification.   Def is currently also under a civil commitment order - 4 mos term.  Statement as to bond request - argues against cash bond, will not meet Huber on civil matters.  No intentional behavior, had a flat tire on the way to court.  Does not agree with bond request.  Asks that Signature Bond be continued at this time.  Def cannot confirm employment.  State declines to amend bond request.  Statement by Atty Zouski.  Defendant intends to address these matters in Federal Court very soon.  The Court:  Cash Bond of $200 ordered - Defendant has indicated he has the ability to pay a lesser sum.  AIA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
In WC Jail

The court will entertain a motion for withdrawal of counsel if filed by Atty Templeton.
